intro: Hieracium gymnocephalum f. subglandulosum, commonly known as the glandular hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, typical of the daisy family. It is native to parts of Europe and is often found in meadows and grassy areas. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and protected species in some regions.
